criticalIssues.title: No Undo/Redo on Android
criticalIssues.description: Android's TextInput does not guarantee undo/redo support. Many keyboards don't provide this functionality, leaving users with no recovery option.
criticalIssues.impact: Users can accidentally delete large amounts of text with no way to recover
criticalIssues.userScenario: User types 500 words ‚Üí Accidentally selects all ‚Üí Accidentally pastes/types over ‚Üí Content lost forever
criticalIssues.recommendation: Implement custom history stack with undo/redo buttons

criticalIssues.title: Inconsistent Cross-Platform Experience
criticalIssues.description: iOS users get shake-to-undo, web users get Ctrl+Z, Android users get nothing. No unified experience.
criticalIssues.impact: Fragmented UX, platform-dependent workflows, users don't know what to expect
criticalIssues.recommendation: Provide consistent UI buttons and keyboard shortcuts across all platforms

criticalIssues.title: No Visual Feedback

proposedSolution.approach: Custom history stack with UI controls
features: Manual history tracking of text changes
Undo/Redo buttons in header (disabled when not available)
Debounced history snapshots to avoid too many states
Max history limit (e.g., 50 states) to prevent memory issues
Works consistently on iOS, Android, and Web
Visual disabled states when at history boundaries

architecture.historyStack: Array of {content: string, cursor: {start: number, end: number}}
architecture.currentIndex: Pointer to current position in history
architecture.debounce: 500ms delay before creating new history entry

issue1_toolbarBypassDebounce.problem: Toolbar actions (Bold, Italic, etc.) should create immediate history entries, not wait 500ms
issue1_toolbarBypassDebounce.solution: Add optional skipDebounce parameter to addToHistory()

implementation.addToHistory: const addToHistory = useCallback((newContent: string, newSelection: {start: number, end: number}, skipDebounce = false) => { ... }
implementation.toolbarUsage:
// In handleInsert and handleInsertText:
addToHistory(newContent, selectionRef.current, true); // skipDebounce=true

issue1_toolbarBypassDebounce.rationale: Users expect formatting to be undoable as discrete actions, not merged with typing

issue2_flagTimingRaceCondition.problem: Using ref + setTimeout for isAddingToHistory creates race conditions and fragile timing dependencies
issue2_flagTimingRaceCondition.solution: Replace ref-based flag with state-based isUndoRedoAction flag
issue2_flagTimingRaceCondition.rationale: State-based approach is deterministic, no setTimeout race conditions, works with React render cycle

issue3_historyInitialization.problem: When editing existing notes, history starts empty instead of with loaded content. Parent component cannot access child's history state.
issue3_historyInitialization.solution: Initialize history with value prop inside MarkdownEditor using lazy initializer or mount effect

implementation.lazyInitializer: const [history, setHistory] = useState(() => [{content: value || '', selection: {start: 0, end: 0}}]);

issue3_historyInitialization.rationale: Lazy initializer is cleaner. Mount effect works if value changes after mount. Both keep history logic encapsulated in child component.

issue4_handlerExposurePattern.problem: Phase 2 step 1 didn't show HOW to expose handlers from child to parent
issue4_handlerExposurePattern.solution: Two patterns: callback props or imperative handle with forwardRef
issue4_handlerExposurePattern.rationale: Callback pattern is simpler. Imperative handle gives parent direct control. Choose based on use case.

issue5_queueMicrotaskVsSetTimeout.problem: setTimeout(..., 0) relies on event loop timing which varies by environment and can race with React renders
issue5_queueMicrotaskVsSetTimeout.solution: Use queueMicrotask() which executes after current task but before next event loop iteration
issue5_queueMicrotaskVsSetTimeout.rationale: queueMicrotask is deterministic, executes after synchronous code but before rendering, preventing race conditions

issue6_webOnlyKeyboardShortcuts.problem: document.addEventListener only exists on web, causes runtime errors on iOS/Android
issue6_webOnlyKeyboardShortcuts.solution: Platform check before adding listeners, document that shortcuts are web-only

implementation.documentation: Add note to Phase 3: 'Keyboard shortcuts only work on web. Mobile uses UI buttons only.'

issue6_webOnlyKeyboardShortcuts.rationale: Mobile soft keyboards don't have Ctrl/Cmd keys. Web gets enhanced UX with shortcuts, mobile gets consistent UI buttons.

technicalConsiderations.debouncing: 500ms prevents creating a state for every keystroke, reduces history size
technicalConsiderations.memoryManagement: 50 state limit prevents unbounded growth, oldest states removed first
technicalConsiderations.cursorTracking: Each history entry includes cursor position for accurate restoration
technicalConsiderations.branching: Redo history is discarded when new content is added from middle of history
technicalConsiderations.autoSave: History tracking should not interfere with existing auto-save mechanism
technicalConsiderations.toolbarActions: Bold, Italic, etc. create immediate history entries via skipDebounce=true parameter
technicalConsiderations.stateFlagApproach: isUndoRedoAction state prevents infinite loops when undo/redo triggers onChange
technicalConsiderations.historyInitialization: Initialize history with initial value prop using lazy useState initializer or useEffect on mount
technicalConsiderations.raceConditionPrevention: queueMicrotask() ensures flag resets after React render cycle, more deterministic than setTimeout(0)
technicalConsiderations.handlerExposure: Two patterns: callback-based (onUndoRedoChange) or imperative handle (useImperativeHandle + forwardRef)
technicalConsiderations.keyboardShortcuts: Web only - document.addEventListener only available on web platform, mobile relies on UI buttons
technicalConsiderations.platformDetection: Use Platform.OS !== 'web' check before adding keyboard listeners to prevent runtime errors
